page.title: 08MAYPOLE CUSTOMS
page.content: To secure a{Maypole}villagers 'ear-mark' a suitable tree towards the end of April.This is usually stolen during the night from a neighbouring village,brought home and 'rinded' (bark stripped) under cover of darkness before being raised through the night of April 31st. For some years traditional Maypoles like this have been seen in Lanreath and Pelynt. The aim is to keep your own pole throughout May.Men keep guard day and night and only when the vigil is relaxed can the pole be stolen and brought home to be erected in another village.In modern times chain saws and diggers have been used.Before,men removed poles by hand. In latter years poles have been stolen and hidden in trees,churches and potato rows.In the 1940s a set of skittles and ball was carved from a Maypole.
